rounds.response:
My hand is A-J and the board is J-3-J-3, giving me Jacks full of Threes (JJJ33).  
This is a monster full house.  
It’s far ahead of almost anything Villain can hold – the only hand that beats us is pocket 3s, which is extremely unlikely after Villain checked the flop.  
We want maximum value from any pocket pair, any Jack, or even random bluffs Villain might carry to the river.

I’ll over-bet the pot (90 chips) to look polarised and spark a shove or call.

[Bet 90]
